intro: Eucalyptus nudicaulis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mallees, is a species of eucalyptus native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its slender, hairless stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery bloom. The plant produces small, globular clusters of white or pale yellow flowers, which appear in late winter to early spring. Its bark is typically smooth and peels in thin, papery strips, and it is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Eucalyptus nudicaulis is adapted to withstand drought and is an important component of local ecosystems.
